info.name: AutoRename
info.summary: Automatically rename and move files based on configurable rules
info.description:
AutoRename is a Nextcloud app that renames and organizes newly added or moved files based on user-defined rules. By placing a `.rename.conf` file in a folder, users can specify regex-based patterns to rename or move files.
Renaming is handled by a background job that runs every few minutes, so changes may not be immediate.
Features: - 📝 Define renaming rules using powerful regular expressions. - 📂 Move files to subfolders specified in the new name (e.g., `subfolder/new_name`). - 📅 Insert metadata like dates, EXIF data, or file modification times into filenames using placeholders](https://github.com/powerflo/files_autorename/tree/main?tab=readme-ov-file#what-placeholders-can-i-use-in-the-replacement-string). - 🔄 Transform filenames to [uppercase or lowercase](https://github.com/powerflo/files_autorename/tree/main?tab=readme-ov-file#how-do-i-rename-files-with-upperlowercase-changes).
